com.burstly.lib.feature.networks
Interface IAdaptorFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractAdaptorFactory, AdmobAdaptorFactory, BurstlyAdaptorFactory, GreystripeAdaptorFactory, InmobiAdaptorFactory, JumptapAdaptorFactory, MillennialAdaptorFactory
public interface IAdaptorFactory

This interface describes factory for IBurstlyAdaptor objects.

Author:
Alexey Redinskii

Method Summary
 IBurstlyAdaptor createAdaptor(Map<String,?> params)
          Creates a new adaptor instance.
There are three available parameters by default in params: key - "context", value - Context instance of current context key - "viewId", value - String view id of BurstlyView instance for which adaptor will be created key - "adaptorName", value - String name of the adaptor to create, passed from the server in parameters.
 void destroy()
          Destroys the factory.
 void initialize(Map<String,?> params)
          Initializes the ad network.
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize(Map<String,?> params)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
Initializes the ad network. This method is supposed to do all initialization heavy lifting for the network. There is just one instance of the factory per running application. This method is called only once during the factory construction.

Parameters:
params - Map parameters needed to initialize the factory
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException

createAdaptor

IBurstlyAdaptor createAdaptor(Map<String,?> params)
Creates a new adaptor instance.
There are three available parameters by default in params:
  • key - "context", value - Context instance of current context
  • key - "viewId", value - String view id of BurstlyView instance for which adaptor will be created
  • key - "adaptorName", value - String name of the adaptor to create, passed from the server in parameters. Generally IBurstlyAdaptor.getNetworkName() should return this value

Parameters:
params - Map parameters needed to create an adaptor
Returns:
IBurstlyAdaptor instance

destroy

void destroy()
Destroys the factory. This method must perfrom a full cleanup. All background activities must be stopped. All resources must be freed. There is no guarantee for this method to be called.
